meanings.definition: The quality of being irritable or quarrelsome.
meanings.sent1: Her fractiousness often led to arguments with her siblings.
meanings.sent2: The fractiousness of the meeting made it hard to reach a decision.
meanings.sent3: The fractiousness of the cat when it didn't get its favorite treat was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The fractiousness of the stormy weather mirrored the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The fractiousness of the toddler's tantrum was heard throughout the house.

meanings.definition: The state of being unruly or difficult to control.
meanings.sent1: The teacher struggled to manage the fractiousness of the class after recess.
meanings.sent2: The fractiousness of the wild horses made them hard to tame.
meanings.sent3: The fractiousness of the garden gnomes running around the yard was a sight to see.
meanings.sent4: The fractiousness of the river as it flowed through the canyon symbolized nature's untamed spirit.
meanings.sent5: The fractiousness of the old car made it a challenge to drive smoothly.
